page.title: 02OTMOOR - A RECENT HISTORY
page.content: Prior to the land's enclosure in the early 1800's the local population enjoyed unrestricted grazing rights. These were lost subsequently and the famous Otmoor Riots of 1830 did little to reverse the situation.Waggon-making, thatching,quarrying and farming were the major employers of the time.Fields on the moor were given names that suggest they were of local origin.Being close to Oxford many people take advantage of the area's unique environment.It is used for many pursuits besides farming including riding,ornithology,nature study and walking.Despite drainage projects that have taken place the land has been little improved and remains primarily grazing land with some mixed farming at the fringes.Controversial plans to route the M40 Motorway extenion across the area are currently under review.
